data: PED ORTHO Musculoskeletal Tumour - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue PED ANES Pre-Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan

See Plastic Surgery orders for microvascular flap post-operative orders
Reinforce PRN, Do not change dressing until ordered by physician/nurse practitioner
Site: Right Upper Extremity, 125 mmhg, Pressure interval: continuous
Site: Left Upper Extremity, 125 mmhg, Pressure interval: continuous
Site: Right Lower Extremity, 125 mmhg, Pressure interval: continuous
Site: Left Lower Extremity, 125 mmhg, Pressure interval: continuous
Therapy type: VAC,  Other (please specify), Discontinue VAC dressing Post-Op day _____ and change to regular dry dressing
To gravity. While patient is in Anesthetic Care Unit, assess as per Anesthetic Care Unit Assessment Standards, once patient has been admitted to inpatient unit, please follow
Notify Treating Provider if drainage from hemovac/chest tube/Jackson-Pratt Drains greater than 250 mL within 4 hours
Suction Type: Self-Suction, Monitor q1h for 12 hours then q12h. Empty and record q2h for 12 hours then q12h. Leave in until ordered by physician/nurse practitioner
Suction Type: Self-Suction, Monitor q1h for 12 hours then q12h. Empty and record q2h for 12 hours then q12h. Remove when less than 30 mL in 24 hours
Suction Type: Self-Suction, Monitor q1h for 12 hours then q12h. Empty and record q2h for 12 hours then q12h. Leave in until ordered by physician/nurse practitioner
Suction Type: Self-Suction, Monitor q1h for 12 hours then q12h. Empty and record q2h for 12 hours then q12h. Remove when less than 30 mL in 24 hours
Suction Type: Self-Suction, Monitor q1h for 12 hours then q12h. Empty and record q2h for 12 hours then q12h. Leave in until ordered by physician/nurse practitioner
Suction Type: Self-Suction, Monitor q1h for 12 hours then q12h. Empty and record q2h for 12 hours then q12h. Remove when less than 30 mL in 24 hours
Discontinue foley catheter when continuous morphine infusion has been discontinued
Discontinue Foley when epidural has been discontinued
Discontinue hemovac drain on POD _____ if less than 30mL output in 24h or post-op day _____ if drain is still in-situ
Discontinue Jackson-Pratt (JP) Drain on POD _____ if less than 30mL output in 24h or post-op day _____ if drain is still in-situ
T;N, Activity as tolerated within brace ______ (specify brace)
T;N, Bedrest with head of bed to maximum _____degrees
T;N, Right Upper Extremity, Right hand higher than wrist higher than elbow higher than shoulder
T;N, Left Upper Extremity, Left hand and higher than wrist higher than elbow higher than shoulder
T;N, Right Lower Extremity, Right foot higher than knee higher than hip
T;N, Left Lower Extremity, Left foot higher than knee higher than hip

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
30 mg/kg, IV, q8h, hour, drug form: inj
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, consider clindamycin
10 mg/kg, IV, q8h, hour, drug form: inj
If MRSA or ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, consider vancomycin. Order vancomycin trough and peak levels bloodwork orders in Laboratory Section
15 mg/kg, IV, q6h, hour, drug form: inj
once, If vancomycin order duration longer than 48 hours, draw level 30 minutes prior to 3rd or 4th dose administration
once, If vancomycin order duration longer than 48 hours, draw level 1-2 hour(s) after the end of the infusion of the 3rd or 4th dose
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
Complete Special Authority form for Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) prophylaxis on discharge
q1h for 4 hours, then q2h for 4 hours, then q4h
T;N, Continuous until opioid infusion has been discontinued for 4 hours
Notify physician/nurse practitioner if pain unrelieved and/or neurovascular impairment present
Notify physician/nurse practitioner if increasing opioid requirements
Follow occupational therapy guidelines for splint wear time and assessments

Calculate Pediatric Maintenance Fluids based on 4-2-1 Rule
IV, as directed, PRN, other (see comment), May heparin lock Central Venous Line when drinking well
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)

For pain management orders, including antiemetics and antipruritics, use either the PED SURG Post Op Pain and Symptom Management for Age Greater than or Equal to 6 Months (Multiphase) OR the PED SURG Post Op Pain and Symptom Management for Age Less than 6 Months (Multiphase) PowerPlan
Confirm daily dose injection timing with anesthesia if epidural is removed
1 mg/kg, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 28 day, drug form: inj, start: T+1;1700
1 mg/kg, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 28 day, drug form: inj, start: T+2;1700
No subcutaneous injection/insufflon on operative limb(s)
Bedside Surgical Nurse to do subcutaneous injection teaching
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once for 3 day
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once for 3 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once for 3 day
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 94% or greater
Consider consultation with Acute Pain Service, Hematology and Plastic Surgery
Family Care Conference or Meeting Needed
End of Life, Code Blue, Death
Discharge Planning or Coordinate of Care
